decision_conditions: <p><span style="line-height: normal;">In summary, the proposed single storey side to rear extension by reason of its excessive width, depth and height, and prominent siting in the street scene, would result in an obtrusive, bulky and disproportionate development detracting from the established pattern of development in the area, to the detriment of the character and appearance of the subject dwellinghouse and surrounding locality, contrary to the high-quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy D3 D.1 and D.11 of The&nbsp; London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).</span><br></p>

<p><span style="line-height: normal;">The existing rear extension by reason of its excessive height and siting on the boundary with No.3 Harley Crescent, results in an bulky and overwhelming development, which has an unacceptable impact on its residential amenities, contrary to The National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy D3 of the London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1 (B) of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), policy DM 1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).</span><br></p>
description: Single storey front and side to rear extension (retrospective)
